references.paper_title: 3d semantic parsing of large-scale indoor spaces
references.reason: This paper introduces the ScanNet dataset, a foundational resource for 3D semantic segmentation research used extensively in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Emerging properties in self-supervised vision transformers
references.reason: This paper explores self-supervised learning for vision transformers, a technique relevant to the cross-modal learning aspects of the target paper.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a vision-language model crucial for open-vocabulary semantic segmentation, directly impacting the methodology of the target paper.
This paper introduces denoising diffusion models, a generative technique central to the 2D mask generation component of the target paper’s proposed method.
This paper is among the earliest works on 2D open-vocabulary semantic segmentation, which the target paper extends to the 3D domain.
